rComments: He was such a bad professor. NEVER TAKE HIM. Tests are very hard and lectures would make you want to fall asleep. If you want an A take a different GE

This class was horrible. McCarthy would lecture on basic information about the ocean and other aspects in class and then his tests would be incredibly hard (nothing that we had really covered). His tests were super in depth and he wouldn't teach us to the ability that he expected to perform at. He was enthusiastic but was also gone for about a week

Class is super boring. Sections are mandatory, you have to do a research paper and a presentation at the end of the quarter. TA is a kinda hard grader so make sure to take time on the work you turn in, as they are a huge part of your grade. Midterm and final were pretty easy. The work I turned in and the presentation  is what brought my grade down
Really nice prof.  Good intro class.

Cool professor. Laid back, funny speaker with interesting approaches to the topic. Interesting class, not too difficult! The packets in section are a little annoying and tend to be math heavy, but as a non-math skilled person they are manageable. TA;s are helpful! Research paper is only major assignment and it's pretty straightforward. Reccomend!

This class was an easy A. Sections are mandatory and you have hw in them but its easy. Never went to class but when I did go he made the subject matter entertaining and intresting. Midterm is medium difficultly and the final is super easy. He gives you a study guide for both which will prepare you.

This class is pretty easy. The professor is really passionate & he does his best to get the class involved so it's not just a boring lecture. Also he gave us ~10 minute break every class so we didn't have to sit for 2hrs straight. The TB was really helpful for tests but I didn't use it otherwise & I got an A. The Final paper is really tough though.

Avoid this class if you are looking for an easy A. He is a great guy, the subject is very hard! There is a lot of math involved, very confusing math(the TA aren't very helpful, especially Natasha). Classes are mandatory because of the quizzes. There' a five page research paper, midterm, final and two field trips.  I don't recommend this class.

He's definitely passionate about what he teaches as he's loud and quite a personality, which will keep you fairly awake in his class (unless like me you nap in between the 10 minute breaks he gives out in the middle of lecture). If oceanography is your thing, this class is for you. If it's not, and for a GE instead, tough luck staying in class.
interesting class... knew a lot and was helpful..

He's a riot. First college class where you get the feeling of the professor being a human, not an encyclopedia of facts. Highly recommend him, he wants to keep you interested and help you absorb the material he covers. Loves to talk about his dog and uses mathematical units of him to pass on concepts. overall: AWESOME!!!!
he is so hilarious one of the problems on his test was to find the volume of a beach in the units of his pet dog it was a fun class everyone laughs in this class!
Very interesting and easy class

Midterm/final (multiple choice) are easy if you use his studyguides/study his powerpoints well (are posted online).  Hw packets aren't too difficult. Attend all sections. You will have an end of the quarter paper/project. He is usually clear/concise/understandable lecturer. Barely have to use textbook.

This class was awesome! go to section and give good effort on the assignments there, go to the TAs if you need help, study from the study guides and go to class because he has random quizzes, and you have an A. His class is great though, he is humorous and friendly. This class also took care of my Q gen ed, very easy math problems.

I love this man; this class was the first class I've ever had where I actually looked forward to going to class.  Just go to lecture, don't bother with the book... his lectures were very interesting, and it was easy to grasp the concepts. Plus there was always a little comic relief nerd style. HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM!

Easiest class I have ever had.  Pay attention, work on the homework in advanced so that you can ask questions, and go to office hours and you will get an A. He is very helpful, fun, and keeps you interested.
He's a great teacher.  He uses examples that we can relate to inorder for us to grasp the conscepts.

This class is sometimes difficult, because some concepts are abstract or difficult to grasp, and there is some mathematics involved.  However, Professor McCarthy does everything possible to help students succeed, including posting his lecture slides online and providing a review sheet.  He is very funny, and a really nice guy.

I liked Matt a lot and the material is rather dry but then again the subject matter itself can be hard to be enthusiastic about. I took this just to satisfy a general ed requirement but he made it as enjoyable as he could. Tests are hard and some of the assignments in section were hard. Not an easy A but you can do it.

Matt has a great sense of humor and keeps the class fun. In one class he even played a clip of finding Nemo to demonstrate a point about currents. During tests he is very helpful if you have any questions. Be warned, the quantitative section can be confusing (esp on tests) but just ask and he'll explain.

This man is hilarious!!! It's the only thing that kept me from going to class, tho, I'm afraid. His tests are rather ridiculous, and you have to take really good notes in class (or else read the book) in order to prepare for them. It knocks off a couple of GE's, tho, so that's a huge plus. Very enthusiastic! I'd recommend it if you're dedicated

Matt's laid back style and high expectations are a great combination. I really enjoyed this class. He has a strange relationship with donuts which means he often brings a box to class. I think I gained 5 pounds the quarter I took his class. :-)
Great smile and enthusiasm. Lots of interesting lectures. I recommend his class.
This seminar class was really easy. Matt is an extreamly cool guy who knows a lot about Oceanography.

McCarthy made the oceans class really interesting.  He had all his powerpoints online which made the midterm/final easy to study for.  Overall McCarthy is a great professor - I would recomend taking this class with him.

I had his class spring 05, although the content isnt one that greatly interests me, Prof. McCarthy showed muchinterest in the subject and was very clear in conveying the important information from the material. he was helpful, and although he does just lecture, he tries to keep it interesting and sometimes his comment are funny, either way i usually fall asleep and i didnt , i also got a B+ he's easy to learn from.
